info.name: Connectra API
info.description:
Complete Postman collection for Connectra API.

**Implemented Endpoints**:
- **Companies**:
  - Search/filter (`POST /companies`), Count (`POST /companies/count`)
  - CRUD: Create (`POST /companies/create`), Update (`PUT /companies/:uuid`), Delete (`DELETE /companies/:uuid`), Get by UUID (`GET /companies/:uuid`), Upsert (`POST /companies/upsert`)
  - Bulk: Bulk Upsert (`POST /companies/batch-upsert`)
- **Contacts**:
  - Search/filter (`POST /contacts`), Count (`POST /contacts/count`)
  - CRUD: Create (`POST /contacts/create`), Update (`PUT /contacts/:uuid`), Delete (`DELETE /contacts/:uuid`), Get by UUID (`GET /contacts/:uuid`), Upsert (`POST /contacts/upsert`)
  - Bulk: Bulk Upsert (`POST /contacts/batch-upsert`)
- **Common**: Filters (`GET /common/:service/filters`), Filter Data (`POST /common/:service/filters/data`), Batch Upsert (`POST /common/batch-upsert`), Upload URL (`GET /common/upload-url`), Jobs (`POST /common/jobs`, `POST /common/jobs/create`)
- **System**: Health Check (`GET /health`), Database Health (`GET /health/db`)

**Features**:
- Full CRUD operations for Companies and Contacts
- Standardized error responses with error codes
- Field selection via `select_columns` parameter
- **Account-Based Filtering**: Filter contacts by company attributes using denormalized `company_*` fields (e.g., `company_industries`, `company_employees_count`)
- **Company Data Population**: Use `company_config.populate: true` to include full company objects in contact responses
- Automatic Elasticsearch indexing
- Soft delete support

**Key Concepts**:
- **Denormalized Fields** (`company_*` prefix): Use in `where` clauses for filtering contacts by company attributes. These are filter-only and NOT available in `select_columns`.
- **Company Config**: Use `company_config.select_columns` with direct field names (no prefix) to get company data in responses.
- **VQL (Vivek Query Language)**: Supports text matches (exact, shuffle, substring), keyword matches, and range queries

**Documentation**: All endpoints align with documentation in `docs/`. See [Company API](./docs/company.md) and [Contact API](./docs/contacts.md) for complete endpoint documentation.

item.name: Companies

request.description:
Search and retrieve companies based on VQL (Vivek Query Language) filter criteria. Uses hybrid search approach combining Elasticsearch for fast filtering and PostgreSQL for detailed data retrieval.

**Endpoint**: `POST /companies`

**Pagination Limits**:
- `page`: Maximum 10 (1-indexed)
- `limit`: Maximum 100, default 25

**Field Selection**:
- Use `select_columns` to limit returned fields and optimize response size
- Response-only fields (e.g., `facebook_url`, `twitter_url`, `phone_number`) can be included in `select_columns` but cannot be used in filters

**See**: [Company Filters Guide](../../docs/filters/01-company-filters-complete-guide.md) | [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#1-list-companies-by-filters)

item.name: Search Companies by Exact Phrase (with Slop)

request.description:
Example: Phrase matching with word order using exact search type.

**Key Points**:
- Uses `search_type: "exact"` for phrase matching
- `slop: 1` allows 1 word between terms (e.g., "artificial intelligence" matches "artificial general intelligence")
- Word order matters (unlike shuffle)
- Use `slop: 0` for exact phrase match, higher slop for more flexibility

**See**: [Company Filters Guide - Exact Search](../../docs/filters/01-company-filters-complete-guide.md#search-type-exact)

item.name: Search Companies - Shuffle with OR Operator

request.description:
Example: Flexible word matching with OR operator - matches any of the words.

**Key Points**:
- Uses `search_type: "shuffle"` with `operator: "or"`
- Matches companies with ANY of the words: "software" OR "technology" OR "saas"
- Word order doesn't matter (shuffle)
- `fuzzy: true` enables typo tolerance
- Default operator is "and" (all words must match)

**See**: [Company Filters Guide - Shuffle Search](../../docs/filters/01-company-filters-complete-guide.md#search-type-shuffle)

Example: Find companies by partial name match using substring search. Useful for autocomplete-style searches.

**Key Points**:
- Uses `search_type: "substring"` with `name` field
- Minimum 3 characters required (min_gram: 3)
- Matches companies like "Software Corp", "Microsoft", "SoftTech"
- Only the `name` field supports substring search for companies

**See**: [Company Filters Guide - Substring Search](../../docs/filters/01-company-filters-complete-guide.md#substring-text-search)

Example: Complex multi-criteria search demonstrating must_not logic.

**Key Points**:
- Includes AI companies but excludes "consulting" companies (must_not in text_matches)
- Includes Software/Technology industries but excludes "Legacy"/"Outdated" keywords (must_not in keyword_match)
- Combines text matches, keyword matches, and range queries
- Uses `select_columns` including response-only fields (`facebook_url`, `twitter_url`)
- Multiple sort fields for stable ordering

**Note**: Response-only fields like `facebook_url` and `twitter_url` can be selected but cannot be used in filters.

**See**: [Company Filters Guide - Combined Filters](../../docs/filters/01-company-filters-complete-guide.md#combined-filter-patterns)

Example: Use cursor-based pagination (`search_after`) for efficient deep pagination of large company datasets.

**Key Points**:
- Use `search_after` instead of `page` for pagination beyond page 10
- `search_after` values come from the last document in the previous response
- Requires explicit `order_by` with consistent sort fields
- Always include `id` as the last sort field for stable pagination
- `search_after` array must match the order and types of `order_by` fields

**See**: [Company Filters Guide - Cursor Pagination](../../docs/filters/01-company-filters-complete-guide.md#cursor-based-pagination-search_after)

Get the total count of companies matching the filter criteria without retrieving the actual records.

**Endpoint**: `POST /companies/count`

**See**: [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#2-count-companies-by-filters)

Retrieve all available filter metadata for companies.

**Endpoint**: `GET /common/companies/filters`

**See**: [API Reference - Get Filters](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#3-get-company-filters)

Retrieve available values for a specific filter (useful for dropdowns/autocomplete).

**Endpoint**: `POST /common/companies/filters/data`

**Request Body**: Must include `service: "company"` and `filter_key`.

**See**: [API Reference - Get Company Filter Data](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#4-get-company-filter-data)

**Planned Endpoint**: `POST /companies/create`

**Status**: See [CRUD Implementation Plan](../../docs/CRUD_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md) for implementation details.

**Current Alternative**: Use `POST /companies/batch-upsert` for creating companies.

**Planned Functionality**:
- Create a new company record with automatic Elasticsearch indexing
- **Validation Rules**:

  - `normalized_domain`: Optional, must be valid domain format
  - `employees_count`, `annual_revenue`, `total_funding`: Must be non-negative integers
  - `linkedin_url`, `website`: Must be valid URL format
- **Response**: 201 Created with company data

**See**: [Company API - Create Company](../../docs/company.md#5-create-company) | [CRUD Implementation Plan](../../docs/CRUD_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md)

request.description:
⚠️ **NOT IMPLEMENTED** - This endpoint is not yet implemented in the codebase.

**Planned Endpoint**: `POST /companies/upsert`

**Status**: See [CRUD Implementation Plan](../../docs/CRUD_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md) for implementation details.

**Current Alternative**: Use `POST /companies/batch-upsert` for upserting companies.

**Planned Functionality**:
- Create a new company or update an existing one (identified by UUID or normalized_domain)
- **Upsert Logic**:
  1. If company with matching UUID exists → update
  2. If company with matching normalized_domain exists → update
  3. Otherwise → create new company
- **Response**: 200 OK with company data

**See**: [Company API - Upsert Company](../../docs/company.md#8-upsert-company) | [CRUD Implementation Plan](../../docs/CRUD_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md)

request.description:
Efficiently create or update multiple companies in a single request.

**Endpoint**: `POST /companies/batch-upsert`

**Validation**:
- `companies`: Required array with minimum 1 item
- Each company must have `name` field
- UUIDs generated automatically if not provided

**Response**: 200 OK with count of processed companies

**Performance**:
- Uses PostgreSQL `ON CONFLICT` for atomic upsert
- Batch Elasticsearch indexing for efficiency
- Can handle 1000+ records per request

**Best Practices**:
- Batch size: 100-500 records recommended
- Validate data before sending
- Monitor response times for large batches

**See**: [Company API - Bulk Upsert Companies](../../docs/company.md#9-bulk-upsert-companies) | [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#9-bulk-upsert-companies)

item.description: Companies API endpoints for searching, filtering, and retrieving company data. Uses hybrid search approach combining Elasticsearch for fast filtering and PostgreSQL for detailed data retrieval.

item.name: Contacts

request.description:
Search and retrieve contacts based on VQL (Vivek Query Language) filter criteria.

**Endpoint**: `POST /contacts`

**Pagination Limits**:
- `page`: Maximum 10 (1-indexed)
- `limit`: Maximum 100, default 25

**Account-Based Filtering**:
- Use denormalized `company_*` fields (e.g., `company_industries`, `company_employees_count`, `company_annual_revenue`) in `where` clauses to filter contacts by company attributes in a single query
- These fields are **ONLY for filtering** and are NOT available in `select_columns`

**Company Data Population**:
- Use `company_config.populate: true` with `company_config.select_columns` to include full company objects in responses
- Use direct field names (e.g., `name`, `employees_count`) in `company_config.select_columns`, NOT `company_*` prefix

**Example Use Cases**:
- Filter contacts at software companies: `company_industries: ["Software"]`
- Find contacts at high-revenue companies: `company_annual_revenue: {gte: 5000000}`
- Combine with company data: Use `company_config` to get company details in response

**See**: [Contact Filters Guide](../../docs/filters/02-contact-filters-complete-guide.md) | [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#get-contact-filter-endpoints) | [Select Columns Guide](../../docs/filters/select_columns_filter.md)

item.name: Filter Contacts by Company Attributes (Denormalized Fields)

request.description:
Example: Filter contacts by company attributes using denormalized `company_*` fields. This demonstrates single-query account-based filtering without needing a separate company query.

**Key Points**:
- ✅ Uses `company_*` prefix fields (e.g., `company_industries`, `company_employees_count`) in `where` clause for filtering
- ✅ Combines contact filters (seniority, email_status) with company filters in one query
- ❌ Denormalized fields are NOT available in `select_columns`

**Use Case**: Find senior, verified contacts at high-revenue software companies in North America.

**See**: [Combined Filters Guide](../../docs/filters/03-combined-filters-guide.md#strategy-3-direct-company-field-filtering-single-query) | [Denormalized Fields Documentation](../../docs/filters/02-contact-filters-complete-guide.md#denormalized-company-fields)

Example: Find contacts at companies with partial name match using substring search on denormalized `company_name` field.

**Key Points**:
- Uses `search_type: "substring"` with `company_name` field
- Minimum 5 characters required for substring search (min_gram: 5)
- Matches companies like "Microsoft", "Microsystems", etc.
- Useful for autocomplete-style searches

**See**: [Contact Filters Guide - Substring Search](../../docs/filters/02-contact-filters-complete-guide.md#example-search-contacts-by-company-name-substring)

Example: Complex multi-criteria search with must_not exclusions.

**Key Points**:
- Includes software engineers but excludes interns (must_not in text_matches)
- Includes verified emails but explicitly excludes invalid ones (must_not in keyword_match)
- Combines text matches, keyword matches, and date range queries
- Uses `select_columns` including response-only fields (`facebook_url`, `twitter_url`, `stage`)
- Multiple sort fields for stable ordering

**Note**: Response-only fields like `facebook_url`, `twitter_url`, and `stage` can be selected but cannot be used in filters.

**See**: [Contact Filters Guide - Combined Filters](../../docs/filters/02-contact-filters-complete-guide.md#combined-filter-patterns)

Example: Filter contacts by company attributes AND populate full company objects in the response.

**Key Points**:
- ✅ Uses denormalized `company_*` fields in `where` clause for filtering
- ✅ Uses `company_config.populate: true` to get company data in response
- ✅ Uses direct field names (no `company_*` prefix) in `company_config.select_columns`
- ❌ Denormalized fields are NOT in `select_columns` (they're filter-only)

**Response Structure**:
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 123,
      "first_name": "John",
      "last_name": "Doe",
      "company_id": "company-uuid",
      "company": {
        "uuid": "company-uuid",
        "name": "Acme Software",
        "employees_count": 150,
        "industries": ["Software", "SaaS"],
        "annual_revenue": 7500000,
        "website": "https://acme.com"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

**See**: [Company Config Documentation](../../docs/filters/02-contact-filters-complete-guide.md#populating-company-data-in-responses-company_config) | [Select Columns Guide](../../docs/filters/select_columns_filter.md)

Example: Account-based marketing pattern - Find decision-makers at high-value companies using denormalized fields.

**Goal**: Find decision-makers at high-value companies in a single query.

**Key Points**:
- Uses denormalized `company_*` fields for efficient single-query filtering
- Targets mid-size companies (100-1000 employees)
- High revenue threshold ($5M+) and funding ($10M+)
- Multiple target departments for account-based approach
- Senior roles only for decision-maker targeting

**Benefits**:
- Single API call instead of two (company query + contact query)
- Faster execution (no need to fetch company IDs first)
- Simpler code (no need to extract and pass company IDs)

**See**: [Combined Filters Guide - High-Value Account Targeting](../../docs/filters/03-combined-filters-guide.md#pattern-1-high-value-account-targeting)

Example: Find engineering contacts at companies using specific technologies.

**Use Case**: Technology stack alignment - find contacts at companies using your tech stack for partnership or sales opportunities.

**Key Points**:
- Filters contacts by company technology stack using `company_technologies`
- Targets engineering departments at mid-size+ companies
- Single query using denormalized fields

**See**: [Combined Filters Guide - Technology Stack Targeting](../../docs/filters/03-combined-filters-guide.md#strategy-3-technology-stack--technical-roles)

Example: Use cursor-based pagination (`search_after`) for efficient deep pagination of large result sets.

**Key Points**:
- Use `search_after` instead of `page` for pagination beyond page 10
- `search_after` values come from the last document in the previous response
- Requires explicit `order_by` with consistent sort fields
- Always include `id` as the last sort field for stable pagination
- `search_after` array must match the order of `order_by` fields

**How It Works**:
1. First request: Omit `search_after`, get first page
2. Extract sort values from last item in response
3. Next request: Include `search_after: [sort_value_1, sort_value_2, ...]`

**See**: [Pagination Guide](../../docs/filters/02-contact-filters-complete-guide.md#cursor-based-pagination)

Get the total count of contacts matching the filter criteria without retrieving the actual records.

**Endpoint**: `POST /contacts/count`

**See**: [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#get-contact-count)

Retrieve all available filter metadata for contacts.

**Endpoint**: `GET /common/contacts/filters`

**See**: [API Reference - Get Filters](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#get-contact-filters)

Retrieve available values for a specific filter (useful for dropdowns/autocomplete).

**Endpoint**: `POST /common/contacts/filters/data`

**Request Body**: Must include `service: "contact"` and `filter_key`.

**See**: [API Reference - Get Contact Filter Data](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#get-contact-filter-data)

item.description: Contacts API endpoints for searching, filtering, and retrieving contact data. Uses hybrid search approach combining Elasticsearch for fast filtering and PostgreSQL for detailed data retrieval. Contacts can optionally include associated company information.

item.name: Jobs

request.description:
Create a background job to import CSV data from S3 into PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch.

**Endpoint**: `POST /common/jobs/create`

**Job Type**: `insert_csv_file`

**Request Body**:
- `job_type` (required): `"insert_csv_file"`
- `job_data` (required):
  - `s3_key` (required): S3 key/path to CSV file (e.g., `"uploads/contacts.csv"`)
  - `s3_bucket` (optional): S3 bucket name (defaults to configured bucket)
- `retry_count` (optional): Number of retry attempts (default: 0)

**Response** (201 Created):
```json
{
  "message": "Job created successfully",
  "success": true
}
```

**Processing Flow**:
1. Job created with status: `"open"`
2. Background worker picks up job (status: `"in_queue"` → `"processing"`)
3. Streams CSV from S3 (never loads full file into memory)
4. Processes in batches (default: 500 records/batch)
5. Parallel writes to PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, and filters table
6. On success: status → `"completed"`
7. On failure: status → `"failed"` (can be retried)

**Use Cases**:
- Import large CSV files (multi-GB support)
- Bulk data migration
- Periodic data syncs

**Best Practices**:
- Upload CSV to S3 first using `/common/upload-url` endpoint
- Set appropriate `retry_count` for critical imports (e.g., 3)
- Use descriptive S3 keys with timestamps
- Monitor job status via `/common/jobs` endpoint

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#1-insert-csv-file-insert_csv_file) | [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#create-job)

item.name: Create Job - Export Contacts to CSV

request.description:
Create a background job to export filtered contact data to S3 as CSV.

**Endpoint**: `POST /common/jobs/create`

**Job Type**: `export_csv_file`

**Request Body**:
- `job_type` (required): `"export_csv_file"`
- `job_data` (required):
  - `service` (required): `"contact"` or `"company"`
  - `s3_bucket` (optional): S3 bucket name (defaults to configured bucket)
  - `vql` (required): VQL query with:
    - `where`: Filter criteria (optional)
    - `select_columns` (required): Fields to include in export
    - `order_by`: Sort order (must include `uuid` for stable pagination)
    - `limit`: Batch size for pagination (default: 500)

**Response** (201 Created):
```json
{
  "message": "Job created successfully",
  "success": true
}
```

**Processing Flow**:
1. Job created with status: `"open"`
2. Background worker picks up job
3. Uses cursor-based pagination (`search_after`) for large datasets
4. Streams data directly to S3 (no memory buffering)
5. On completion: `job_response.s3_key` contains exported file path
6. Status → `"completed"`

**Important**:
- ⚠️ `select_columns` is **required** for export jobs
- Always include `uuid` in `order_by` for stable pagination
- System automatically handles large datasets (millions of records)
- Output file: `{S3_UPLOAD_FILE_PATH}/{job_uuid}.csv`

**Use Cases**:
- Export filtered contact lists
- Generate reports
- Data backup
- Integrations with external systems

**Best Practices**:
- Use specific filters to reduce dataset size
- Only select required columns in `select_columns`
- Monitor job status to get `s3_key` when complete
- Use cursor-based pagination for large exports

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#2-export-csv-file-export_csv_file) | [Select Columns Guide](../../docs/filters/select_columns_filter.md)

item.name: Create Job - Export Companies to CSV

request.description:
Create a background job to export filtered company data to S3 as CSV.

**Endpoint**: `POST /common/jobs/create`

**Job Type**: `export_csv_file`

**Request Body**:
- `job_type` (required): `"export_csv_file"`
- `job_data` (required):
  - `service` (required): `"company"`
  - `s3_bucket` (optional): S3 bucket name (defaults to configured bucket)
  - `vql` (required): VQL query with filters and field selection

**Example**: Export mid-size software companies in USA with revenue > $1M.

**Processing**:
- Uses cursor-based pagination for efficient large dataset export
- Streams directly to S3 (no memory buffering)
- Output file: `{S3_UPLOAD_FILE_PATH}/{job_uuid}.csv`

**Important**:
- ⚠️ `select_columns` is **required**
- Always include `uuid` in `order_by`

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#2-export-csv-file-export_csv_file)

List all jobs with optional filtering.

**Endpoint**: `POST /common/jobs`

**Request Body** (all optional):
- `job_type`: Filter by job type (`"insert_csv_file"` or `"export_csv_file"`)
- `status`: Filter by status(es) (array: `["open", "processing", "completed", "failed"]`)
- `limit`: Max results (default: 25, max: 100)

**Response** (200 OK):
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "uuid": "abc123-def456-ghi789",
      "job_type": "insert_csv_file",
      "data": {
        "s3_key": "uploads/contacts.csv",
        "s3_bucket": "my-bucket"
      },
      "status": "completed",
      "job_response": {
        "messages": "Import completed successfully"
      },
      "retry_count": 0,
      "retry_interval": 30,
      "run_after": null,
      "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00Z",
      "updated_at": "2025-01-15T10:35:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "success": true
}
```

**Job States**:
- `open`: Job created, waiting to be picked up
- `in_queue`: Job queued for processing
- `processing`: Job is being executed
- `completed`: Job finished successfully
- `failed`: Job execution failed
- `retry_in_queued`: Failed job queued for retry
- `retrying`: Job is being retried

**Use Cases**:
- Monitor job status
- Check job history
- Debug failed jobs

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#list-jobs) | [Job States](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#job-states-and-lifecycle)

List jobs filtered by status.

**Example**: Get all open and processing jobs.

**Common Status Filters**:
- `["open"]` - Jobs waiting to be picked up
- `["processing"]` - Currently executing jobs
- `["completed"]` - Successfully finished jobs
- `["failed"]` - Failed jobs that can be retried
- `["open", "processing"]` - Active jobs
- `["completed", "failed"]` - Finished jobs (success or failure)

**Use Cases**:
- Monitor active jobs
- Check for stuck jobs (long `processing` status)
- Review failed jobs for retry
- Audit completed jobs

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#list-jobs) | [Job States](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#job-states-and-lifecycle)

item.name: List Jobs - Filter by Job Type

request.description:
List jobs filtered by job type and status.

**Example**: Get all completed export jobs.

**Job Types**:
- `"insert_csv_file"` - CSV import jobs
- `"export_csv_file"` - CSV export jobs

**Use Cases**:
- Monitor specific job types
- Get export file locations from completed export jobs
- Review import job history
- Filter by type + status combination

**Note**: For export jobs, check `job_response.s3_key` for the exported file location.

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#list-jobs)

List all failed jobs for review and retry.

**Response Fields**:
- `status`: `"failed"`
- `job_response.runtime_errors`: Array of error messages
- `retry_count`: Number of retry attempts
- `run_after`: When retry runner will pick up this job (if retries enabled)

**Use Cases**:
- Review error messages in `job_response.runtime_errors`
- Check retry status and count
- Identify patterns in failures
- Monitor failed job queue

**Retry Logic**:
- Failed jobs are automatically retried by retry runner
- Retry interval: `retry_interval` seconds (default: 30)
- Retries respect `retry_count` limit set at job creation

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#error-handling) | [Retry Logic](../../docs/filters/jobs.md#retry-logic)

item.description:
Jobs API endpoints for asynchronous background job processing. Supports CSV import/export with S3 integration, automatic retries, and distributed processing.

**Features**:
- **Asynchronous Processing**: Jobs are queued and processed in the background
- **Distributed Processing**: Multiple workers can process jobs concurrently
- **Automatic Retries**: Failed jobs can be automatically retried with configurable intervals
- **Memory Efficient**: Streaming CSV processing for large files (multi-GB support)
- **State Management**: Complete job lifecycle tracking with status updates

**Job Types**:
1. **Insert CSV File** (`insert_csv_file`): Import CSV data from S3 into PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch
2. **Export CSV File** (`export_csv_file`): Export filtered contact/company data to S3 as CSV

**Job States**:
- `open` → `in_queue` → `processing` → `completed` (or `failed` → `retry_in_queued` → `processing`)

**See**: [Jobs API Guide](../../docs/filters/jobs.md) | [API Reference](../../docs/filters/06-api-reference.md#jobs-endpoints)
